intro: Tephrosia schweinfurthii, commonly known as African snakeroot, is a flowering plant native to sub-Saharan Africa. It is a shrub or small tree that typically grows to a height of 1–3 meters. The plant features pinnately compound leaves and produces small, yellow flowers clustered in racemes. Its root system is notable for containing compounds used in traditional medicine. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in savanna and woodland habitats.
